Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The reasoning identified the steps in the property onboarding process, making connections between initial contact, documentation review, property manager assignment, inspections, marketing, tenant screening, lease finalization, and quality checks.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: A breakdown of potential ambiguities and areas requiring clarification was identified, based on the provided description. For example, it deduced that the specific criteria for selecting a property manager or handling exceptions needed explanation.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The reasoning generated categories of questions (e.g., Initial Contact & Documentation, Inspections & Compliance) based on patterns and implied gaps in the description of the process.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Hypotheses were formed about potential missing information, such as how exceptions are managed or the sequence of tasks, to guide the formulation of questions.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Key aspects of reasoning were cross-checked against the text to confirm that all major steps in the process were covered in the questions (e.g., marketing, compliance, roles).

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: By reasoning backward from the property onboarding process outcomes (e.g., successful tenant onboarding), probable missing decision points and responsibilities were inferred.
